intro: Demorchis africana, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately lobed and bright yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and forest margins. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
